headline: Warner Bros Discovery to lay off 10% of film group: source
summary: STORY: A source said on Wednesday that Warner Bros Discovery will lay off about 10% of its motion picture group staff ahead of a company restructuring.The cuts will take place in marketing, distribution, production and other units.The source did not reveal the number of people who would be affected.In a staff memo, Motion Picture Group Co-Chairs Pamela Abdy and Michael De Luca said the company began reviewing the film group’s operations in early 2025, -- noting that changes were needed to transform the business as it transitioned to a fully global structure.Warner Bros Discovery has announced plans to split into two publicly traded traded companies.One called Warner Bros, housing the film group and the HBO Max streaming service.The other called Discovery Global, which will include cable channels like CNN and TNT, along with the Discovery+ streaming service.The Warner Bros film division faced major flops in 2024, with movies including "Joker: Folie A Deux" and "Furiosa."The studio, however, has rebounded this year with hits like "A Minecraft Movie," "Sinners" and "Superman."
